messages.content: ComfyUI_GMIC is a custom node for ComfyUI that integrates the G'MIC image-processing suite, allowing users to apply various effects, filters, geometric manipulations, and color adjustments to their images.
Yes, ComfyUI_GMIC is friendly for both beginners and power users, with ongoing documented workflows to help users get started.
To install ComfyUI_GMIC, you can either use the command 'git clone https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC' or copy the comfy_gmic.py file to your custom nodes folder.
What additional software is required to use ComfyUI_GMIC?
To use ComfyUI_GMIC, you need to download the G'MIC Command-line interface (CLI) and G'MIC-Qt stand-alone interface, and add the executable path to your system's PATH.
How can I quickly start using ComfyUI_GMIC?
To quickly start using ComfyUI_GMIC, drag and drop the provided workflow.json file into ComfyUI after installing the custom node and required software.
What platforms has ComfyUI_GMIC been tested on?
ComfyUI_GMIC has been tested on Windows 10 with ComfyUI (March 09 version) and G'MIC (CLI and Qt) 3.3.4.
Where can I find information about other image processing custom nodes for ComfyUI?
You can find information about other image processing custom nodes for ComfyUI on the ComfyUI_GMIC wiki page: https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC/wiki
